text: Click on the Manage button in the top navigation bar. Under the Data Management section, click ECS Inspector . Then, click on Error Codes to access the page. Next, click on the New Error Code button. Enter your input in the following fields: Open Setting Description Input Requirement Setting Description Input Requirement Error Code Enter the Error Code name to be associated to UDRs or batches. Note! The Error Code name must be unique and cannot be edited after creation. Required Description Enter a description of the error code. Optional Reprocessing Group Enter a Reprocessing Group to assign to the Error Code. Note! For reprocessing group items to appear in the dropdown for selection, the reprocessing groups must be defined beforehand. For further information, see https://infozone.atlassian.net/wiki/x/6sb8F . Note! UDRs with several Error Codes mapped to different reprocessing groups cannot be automatically assigned to a reprocessing group. They must be assigned manually. Optional Click Apply to create a single error code. To add multiple error codes, click Add Another . This is a quicker way that is equivalent to clicking Apply and then the New Error Code . An error code will be created with the inputs you had entered and the fields in the dialog will reset for your new input. A success message will appear, indicating that the error code has been successfully created. A new row for the newly added error code will appear in the error code table. Open
title: ECS - Creating an Error Code - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
